DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Status Complete Remission Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the complete remission disease status.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.: An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Discontinued; stopped permanently or temporarily.: The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.: Molecular; relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

Concepts.definition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.
Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.
A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::100: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
